results.definition: lessen the intensity of or calm

examples: ease the pain in your legs

results.definition: freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
freedom from difficulty or hardship or effort
examples: he rose through the ranks with apparent ease
they put it into containers for ease of transportation
I am never at ease with strangers

results.definition: a freedom from financial difficulty that promotes a comfortable state
examples: a life of luxury and ease

results.definition: the condition of being comfortable or relieved (especially after being relieved of distress)
examples: getting it off his conscience gave him some ease
He eased himself into the chair
